articles.title: Credentials Presented to Romanian President
articles.content:
Credentials Presented to Romanian President 
    Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Jo Sung Ju, DPRK ambassador e. p. to Romania, presented his credentials to Traian Basescu, president of Romania, on Nov. 11.
 The Romanian president said that the relations between the two countries have a long tradition and Romania values these relations and will use every possibility to continue to positively develop the relations.

articles.title: U.S. Forces' Moves to Replace Their Combat Equipment by Ultra-Modern Hardware under Fire
articles.content:
U.S. Forces' Moves to Replace Their Combat Equipment by Ultra-Modern Hardware under Fire 
    Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Youth and Students Solidarity of south Korea to Implement the June 15 South-North Joint Declaration reportedly issued a statement on Nov. 9 denouncing the U.S. forces in south Korea for scheming to replace their combat equipment by ultra-modern hardware.
 Referring to the south Korean "Government's Information Bureau's" disclosure of the fact that all the combat equipment of the U.S. forces in south Korea would be replaced by the ultra-modern hardware, the statement said: This clearly proves that the U.S. is stepping up its preparations for a war against the north behind the scene, though it is giving lip-service to "respect for sovereignty" and "peaceful co-existence."    
 The real intention of the U.S. is to bolster up its armed forces in order to invade the north. The U.S. should immediately stop its criminal moves to start a war on the Korean Peninsula and withdraw its troops from south Korea.

Greetings to Chief of Palestinian National Authority
articles.content:
Greetings to Chief of Palestinian National Authority
    Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Monday sent a message of greetings to Chief of the Palestinian National Authority Mahmoud Abbas who is chairman of the Executive Committee of the Palestinian Liberation Organization on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of the proclamation of the State of Palestine.
 The message wholeheartedly wished him and the Palestinian people success in their work to recover legitimate national rights including the right to establish an independent state.

articles.title: Council of IGJVCK Meets
articles.content:
Council of IGJVCK Meets
    Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The 13th meeting of the Council of the International General Joint Venture Company of Korea was held at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 Present there were Vice-Premier of the Cabinet Ro Tu Chol who is chairman of the council of the company, Vice-Chairman of the Central Standing Committee of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan Ryang Su Jong and Chairman of the Korean Committee for the Promotion of International Economic Cooperation Paek Hyon Bong who are vice-chairmen of the council, Vice-Chairman of the State Planning Commission Choe Pae Jin and Chairman of the Federation of Joint Economic Venture of Korean Residents in Japan who are directors of the council and officials concerned.
 The meeting reviewed the last successes and discussed the issues of improving the function and role of the company to suit the actual conditions and enabled to take measures for further activating joint venture, collaboration and processing trade. 
 A resolution of the meeting was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Wreaths to Indian Embassy Here
articles.content:
Wreaths to Indian Embassy Here
    Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries and the Korea-India Friendship Association sent wreaths to the Indian embassy in Pyongyang Monday to express condolences over the death of former Indian President K.R. Narayanan.
 Ryom Sun Gil, chairman of the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea who is chairman of the friendship association, Kim Yong Il, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned visited the embassy, laid wreaths before the photo of the deceased and observed a moment's silence in memory of the late. They also made entries in the mourner's book.

articles.title: DPRK-Guam Football Match Held
articles.content:
DPRK-Guam Football Match Held
     Pyongyang, November 14 (KCNA) -- A football match between the team of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and the team of Guam which belong to the group "N" in the preliminaries for the 12th Asian Youth (under-17) Football Championships was held at Yanggakdo Football Stadium on November 14.
 The DPRK team scored the first goal at around 15 minutes in the first half of the game.    
 The DPRK players netted 4 goals in the first half of the game and 13 goals in the latter half, winning the game with the score of 17:2.
 The DPRK team will meet with the Hong Kong team of China on Nov. 18.
